name: Microsoft Teams modules
title: Microsoft Teams modules

children.text: After connecting to the Microsoft Teams app, you can use the following modules to build your
You can watch, list, retrieve, create, update teams and create and update teams for groups with the following modules.
Retrieves a team's details when a new team/group is created or an existing team is edited.

data.label: Microsoft Teams
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Microsoft Teams account.

children.text: Define the filter settings for the returned groups. You can retrieve only groups whose name or email starts with the specified term.
Set the maximum number of results Make will return during one execution cycle.
You can't currently create a team via this module.

data.label: Microsoft Teams
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Microsoft Teams account.

children.text: Enter the name that is displayed in the address book for the group.
Enter a unique alias for the group. The alias is used as the group's email address and must only contain lowercase letters, numbers, and underscores.
For security groups, simply provide an alias to use as a nickname.
Enable the Unified option (or enter "Unified") to create an
group (used for granting access to SharePoint resources) is created.
Enter the description of the group.
Enable this option if a group is a security group and you have
enabled the "Unified" option in the Group Type field.
Select the owners of the group. The owners are a set of non-admin users who can modify this object.
Select users and groups that are members of this group.
Create a Team  From a Group
Create Microsoft Team by calling from Office 365 Group.
If the group was created less than 15 minutes ago, it's possible for the
Create a Team from a Group
error code due to replication delays. The recommended pattern is to re-run this module three times, with a 10 seconds delay between calls.

data.label: Microsoft Teams
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Microsoft Teams account.

children.text: Select the group ID that you want to create a team from.
Select whether you want to allow the following permissions:
Select whether you want to allow the following permissions:
Select whether you want to allow the following permissions:
Select whether you want to allow the following permissions:

data.label: Microsoft Teams
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Microsoft Teams account.

children.text: Enter the ID or select the group/team you want to update.
Set the Office 365 group to public or private.

data.label: Microsoft Teams
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Microsoft Teams account.

children.text: Enter (map) or select the ID of the team/group you want to retrieve details about.
Returns all teams (including Office 365 Groups) in your account.

data.label: Microsoft Teams
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Microsoft Teams account.

children.text: Define the filter settings for the returned groups. You can retrieve only groups whose name or email starts with the specified term
Select whether to order results by displaying names in ascending or descending order.
Set the maximum number of teams Make will return during one execution cycle.
Retrieves all the teams in Microsoft Teams that you are a member of.

data.label: Microsoft Teams
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Microsoft Teams account.

children.text: Set the maximum number of teams Make will return during one execution cycle.

data.label: Microsoft Teams
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Microsoft Teams account.

children.text: Enter the ID or select the group you want to delete.
You can list, retrieve, create, update, and delete channels with the following modules.
Creates a new channel in a Microsoft Team.

data.label: Microsoft Teams
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Microsoft Teams account.

children.text: Enter the ID or select the team you want to create a channel for.
Enter the name for the new channel.
Updates the properties of the specified channel.

data.label: Microsoft Teams
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Microsoft Teams account.

children.text: Enter the ID or select the team that contains the channel you want to update.
Enter the ID or select the channel you want to update.
Retrieves the properties and relationship of a channel.

data.label: Microsoft Teams
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Microsoft Teams account.

children.text: Enter the ID or select the team that contains the channel you want to retrieve details about.
Enter the ID or select the channel you want to retrieve details about.
Lists all channels in the Microsoft Team.

data.label: Microsoft Teams
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Microsoft Teams account.

children.text: Enter the ID or select the team you want to list channels from.
Set the maximum number of channels Make will return during one execution cycle.
Updates the properties of the specified channel.

data.label: Microsoft Teams
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Microsoft Teams account.

children.text: Enter the ID or select the team that contains the channel you want to delete.
Enter the ID or select the channel you want to delete.
You can watch and send messages and replies with the following modules.
Triggers when someone sends a message in a team's channel or in a chat.

data.label: Microsoft Teams
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Microsoft Teams account.

children.text: Choose a Type of Messages to be Watched
Select the types of messages you want to watch. You can choose between channel and chat messages.
Select or map the Team ID whose channel messages you want to watch.
Select or map the Channel ID whose messages you want to watch.
Select or map the Chat ID whose messages you want to watch.
Set the maximum number of messages Make will return during one execution cycle.
Triggers when a new reply to a selected message is received. Not available for personal accounts.

data.label: Microsoft Teams
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Microsoft Teams account.

children.text: Select or map the Team ID whose replies you want to watch.
Select or map the Channel ID whose replies you want to watch.
Select or map the Message ID whose replies you want to watch.
Set the maximum number of messages Make will return during one execution cycle.
Sends a message to a team's channel or to a chat.

data.label: Microsoft Teams
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Microsoft Teams account.

children.text: Select a message type you want to send. You can choose a channel or chat message.
Select or map the Team ID to which you want to send the message.
Select or map the Channel ID to which you want to send the message.

.

Yes to create a new chat.
Select or map the format in which you want to send the message. For example,
Add attachments to be included with the message. The attachment must be a OneDrive link. External public links will result in an error.
Creates a new reply to a message in the specified channel.

data.label: Microsoft Teams
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Microsoft Teams account.

children.text: Enter (map) the ID of the team that contains the channel you want to reply in.
Enter (map) the ID of the channel where the message you want to reply to is located.
Enter (map) the ID of the original message you want to reply to.
Enter the text you want to send as the reply.
Select the format in which you want to send the message:
You can add members to teams and to groups with the following modules.

data.label: Microsoft Teams
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Microsoft Teams account.

children.text: Enter the new member's profile password.
Add a Member to a Group
Adds a member to an Office 365 Group.

data.label: Microsoft Teams
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Microsoft Teams account.

children.text: Select or map the Group ID to which you want to add the member.
Select or map the Member ID whom you want to add to the group.
You can create, retrieve, update, and delete online meetings with the following modules.

Creates an online meeting. This will be a standalone meeting that is not associated with any event on the user's calendar; therefore, meetings created via this module will not show on the user's calendar.

data.label: Microsoft Teams
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Microsoft Teams account.

children.text: Enter the subject of the online meeting.
Select or map a type of user who can be a presenter in the meeting.
Information about a participant in a meeting.
: Select or map the ID of the user who is attending.
- Select or map the attendee's role in the online meeting.
Select or map whether attendees can turn on their cameras.
Select or map whether attendees can turn on their microphones.
Select or map whether to enable meeting chat.
Select or map whether to enable reactions for the meeting.
Enter the chat information associated with this online meeting.
- Enter the ID of a thread in the Microsoft Teams channel.
- Enter the ID of a message in a Microsoft Teams channel.
-  Enter the ID of the reply message.
Select or map whether to announce when callers join or leave.
Select or map which participants can bypass the meeting lobby.
- Select or map the type of participants that are automatically admitted into a meeting, bypassing the lobby.
- Select or map whether or not to always let dial-in callers bypass the lobby.
Select or map whether to record the meeting automatically.
Updates an online meeting by its ID.

data.label: Microsoft Teams
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Microsoft Teams account.

children.text: Enter the ID associated with the online meeting.
Enter the subject of the online meeting.
Select or map a type of user who can be a presenter in the meeting.
Information about a participant in a meeting.
: Select or map the ID of the user who is attending.
- Select or map the attendee's role in the online meeting.
Select or map whether attendees can turn on their cameras.
Select or map whether attendees can turn on their microphones.
Select or map whether to enable meeting chat.
Select or map whether to enable reactions for the meeting.
Select or map whether to announce when callers join or leave.
Select or map which participants can bypass the meeting lobby.
- Select or map the type of participants that are automatically admitted into a meeting, bypassing the lobby.
- Select or map whether or not to always let dial-in callers bypass the lobby.
Select or map whether to record the meeting automatically.
Retrieves an online meeting by its ID.

data.label: Microsoft Teams
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Microsoft Teams account.

children.text: Enter the ID associated with the online meeting.
Retrieves an online meeting by its ID.

data.label: Microsoft Teams
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Microsoft Teams account.

children.text: Enter the ID associated with the online meeting.
You can search users, retrieve users' statuses, and call APIs with the following modules.
Searches for users by a filter parameter.

data.label: Microsoft Teams
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Microsoft Teams account.

children.text: Add filters to search for users who match your specified filters.
Set the maximum number of users Make will return during one execution cycle.
Retrieves the selected users' availability and activity status.

data.label: Microsoft Teams
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Microsoft Teams account.

children.text: Select or map the users whose status you want to retrieve.
Allows you to perform a custom API call.

data.label: Microsoft Teams
data.overridedLabel: Establish a connection to your Microsoft Teams account.

to retrieve information for an entry.
to make a partial entry update.
Enter the desired request headers. You don't have to add authorization headers; we already did that for you.
Enter the body content for your API call.

customCSS:
<style>
@media print {
  html, body {
    overflow-x: visible;
  }
}
#tally-widget-button {
  position: fixed !important;
  background-color: #FFFFFF;
  display: none;
  visibility: visible !important;
  opacity: 1 !important;
  color: #0C121D;
  border: 2px solid #0C121D;
  border-radius: 4px;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  font-size: 14px;
  font-weight: 600;
  font-family: 'Inter';
  text-align: center;
  box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);
  cursor: pointer;
  z-index: 999999 !important;
  -webkit-tap-highlight-color: transparent;
  outline: none;
  touch-action: manipulation;
  pointer-events: auto;
  transform: translate3d(0, 0, 0);
}
.button-text {
  display: inline-block;
  margin-right: 8px;
}
.button-text::before {
  content: attr(data-text);
}
#tally-widget-popup {
  position: fixed;
  background-color: white;
  display: none;
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 10px 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
  z-index: 999999;
  overflow: hidden;
  border: 0px solid #0C121D;
  padding-top: 30px;
}
#tally-widget-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 10px;
  right: 10px;
  background: none;
  border: none;
  font-size: 36px;
  font-weight: bold;
  padding: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
  color: #0C121D;
}

  .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
    font-family: 'Inter' !important;
  }

  .dark .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #F6F6F6 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column > div > div > div.flex.flex-1.w-full.justify-center.pb-0 > div > div.flex.items-center.pl-0.pr-2.mb-5.xl\:-mt-1\.5 > div > div > div > div:nth-child(1) > div.flex.pr-2.text-gray-500.items-center {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  a.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-public-space-links-wrap .ab-public-space-link:first-of-type {
    border-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-toc-item-active a{
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 {
    text-decoration-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-left:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .ab-nav-left-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-right:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .ab-nav-right-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
#tally-inline-popup {
  position: fixed;
  display: none;
  z-index: 999999;
  width: min(420px, 90vw);
  height: min(550px, 80vh);
  background: #fff;
  color: #0c121d;
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.08);
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 12px 28px rgba(0,0,0,0.22), 0 2px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.12);
  overflow: hidden;
  padding: 5px;
}

#tally-inline-popup iframe {
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  border: 0;
  display: block;
  border-radius: 8px;
}

#tally-inline-popup .tip-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 6px;
  right: 8px;
  width: 32px;
  height: 32px;
  line-height: 28px;
  font-size: 22px;
  text-align: center;
  background: rgba(255,255,255,0.85);
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.06);
  border-radius: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
}

#main-column a[data-form-url],
#main-column a[data-tally-url] {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
  text-decoration: underline;
  text-underline-offset: 2px;
  text-decoration-thickness: 1.5px;
  font-weight: 600;
}

@media (max-width: 640px) {
  #tally-inline-popup {
    width: min(360px, 94vw);
    height: min(500px, 80vh);
  }
}

#main-column .ab-cta-button a.ab-cta-button {
  background-color: #7302D5;
}

/* Titles in purple */
.ab-link-blocks-wrapper .ab-link-block-item.ab-docs-card-mode .ab-link-block-content-wrap .font-bold {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
}

.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
}

</style>

reusableContentVariables.name: string
reusableContentVariables.description: a list or sequence of characters (like letters, numbers, and symbols) used to represent text in a computer programming.

reusableContentVariables.name: Operations
reusableContentVariables.description: An operation is a single module run to process data or check for new data.

reusableContentVariables.name: Credits
reusableContentVariables.description: Credits (formerly operations) are the currency for running scenarios.

reusableContentVariables.name: Route
reusableContentVariables.description: A route is a path that data can flow through in a scenario, visualized as the dotted lines between modules.
